intro: Oplismenus festucoides, commonly known as creeping buttonweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It has fine, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 1 inch long and form dense mats on the ground. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and pastures. Due to its aggressive growth, it is considered a weed in many regions and can be difficult to control.
